title: Intro to Child Psychology
description: Explore developmental theory and learning processes. Ideal for careers in teaching and child support.

title: Foundations of Health Psychology
description: Introduces students to core health psychology concepts including behaviour change, stress, and the biopsychosocial model.

title: Introduction to Forensic Psychology
description: Covers basic concepts such as eyewitness memory, offender profiling, and the psychology of criminal behaviour.

title: Health Psychology in Practice
description: This module explores applied approaches in health psychology, including behaviour change techniques and patient adherence.

title: Child Development and Learning
description: Focuses on key developmental milestones and the role of environment and pedagogy in learning outcomes.

title: Forensic Interviewing Techniques
description: Teaches best practices in interviewing witnesses and suspects using evidence-based techniques.

title: Sport & Exercise Motivation
description: Examine the psychological factors that enhance motivation and performance in sport and physical activity.

title: Cognitive Development in Education
description: Understand how children learn, remember, and solve problems across developmental stages.

title: Health Promotion and Behaviour Change
description: Examines strategies for promoting health at the population level, including campaigns and policy interventions.

title: Advanced Child and Educational Psychology
description: Explores advanced theory and application in developmental assessment, SEN support, and classroom psychology.

title: Psychology of Offending and Rehabilitation
description: Critically evaluates theories of criminal behaviour, rehabilitation approaches, and psychological assessment in forensic settings.

title: Advanced Forensic Case Analysis
description: Critically evaluate real-world case studies in forensic psychology, with emphasis on assessment and ethical decision-making.

title: Organisational Psychology in Practice
description: Apply psychological theory to workplace wellbeing, productivity, and team dynamics.
